metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9653 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: readelf.c in file before 5.22, as used in the Fileinfo component in PHP before 5.4.37, 5.5.x before 5.5.21, and 5.6.x before 5.6.5, does not consider that pread calls sometimes read only a subset of the available data, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (uninitialized memory access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted ELF file.

notes.Note: tyhicks> readelf.c not used in php5 readelf.c does not use pread() in Precise or Lucid but it looks like short read()'s are still a problem

criterions.comment: file package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:5.25-2ubuntu1').
